sentence: Looking at options trading activity among components of the Russell 3000 index, there is noteworthy activity today in CVR Energy Inc (Symbol: CVI), where a total volume of 5,257 contracts has been traded thus far today, a contract volume which is representative of approximately 525,700 underlying shares (given that every 1 contract represents 100 underlying shares).
That number works out to 63.7% of CVI's average daily trading volume over the past month, of 825,110 shares.
Especially high volume was seen for the $17.50 strike call option expiring March 17, 2017 , with 2,450 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 245,000 underlying shares of CVI.

Below is a chart showing CVI's trailing twelve month trading history, with the $17.50 strike highlighted in orange:

Home Depot Inc (Symbol: HD) options are showing a volume of 21,528 contracts thus far today.
That number of contracts represents approximately 2.2 million underlying shares, working out to a sizeable 58.2% of HD's average daily trading volume over the past month, of 3.7 million shares.
Especially high volume was seen for the $135 strike call option expiring August 18, 2017 , with 1,605 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 160,500 underlying shares of HD.

Below is a chart showing HD's trailing twelve month trading history, with the $135 strike highlighted in orange:

And Chefs' Warehouse Inc (Symbol: CHEF) saw options trading volume of 765 contracts, representing approximately 76,500 underlying shares or approximately 53.7% of CHEF's average daily trading volume over the past month, of 142,555 shares.
Especially high volume was seen for the $15 strike put option expiring April 21, 2017 , with 413 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 41,300 underlying shares of CHEF.

Below is a chart showing CHEF's trailing twelve month trading history, with the $15 strike highlighted in orange:
